file_content.text: When you finish with the Voidwolf, just talk to me. I'll make sure no one in Rogun's crew gives you a hard time.
I'll, ah, start ferrying assets to the Republic right now.
Good luck. The Voidwolf's an ugly one.
Is it safe to come out?
I had a feeling this was a good fight to stay out of. Ouch.
Nivi'sec. I'm, ah, Rogun's top man, I guess. Or, ah, your lowliest but very loyal informant... if you'd like to make that arrangement.
Why don't you start by cleaning up that mess.
Sounds good to me.
I said informant, not servant.
What do you have that I want?
What's your deal?
I'm cleaning house. I want nothing to do with Rogun's lackeys.
You're a dead man.
Whoa whoa whoa, hear me out.
I've got what you need to know about the Voidwolf. And access to all of Rogun's resources you haven't already demolished.
Just tell me what you want from me.
Rogun acted like he knew the Voidwolf's plans. Did he let anything slip?
Tell me about the Voidwolf.
The Voidwolf's been collecting every ship in the underworld. Building his own personal fleet.
If Rogun knew his plans beyond that, he never said.
Take whatever Rogun left and contribute it to the war effort. The Republic's running empty right now.
Help the Republic.
Yes, sir. I take it you'll be hunting the Voidwolf yourself?
He's been gathering a fleet. Half the ships in the underworld. Why, I can only imagine.
But I know the Voidwolf's flagship docks near Corellia--he was part of the Empire's invasion force. You want to track him, that's the place.
Just consider me the new Rogun.
Give me everything.
Of course. And since Darmas Pollaran is no longer... um, reliable, perhaps you'd consider me your new distributor?
If you want to hold power for long, you'll have to face the Voidwolf. He's built a personal fleet from every decent ship in the underworld.
Far as I know, they dock near Corellia. You want to get him, that's where to go.
Do I seem like the kind of person who takes down an Imperial Grand Admiral one-to-one?
That's a big assumption.
Maybe if you're heavily armed and he's asleep. And drugged. And very stupid.
A little bit, yeah.
Yes.
That would shame the Empire.
That does sound kind of crazy... what are the chances of foisting him off on the Republic while we retire on a beach somewhere?
You didn't have a problem coming after Rogun.
You're the only one left who's got a chance. And if you hit him, you'll get your old buddies Darmas and Dodonna, too.
The Voidwolf's next on my list. Possibly just under Dodonna and Darmas.
Then that's where I'm going.
They're there, too. With the Voidwolf. Rogun knew they were his pawns--he'd just tracked them to Corellia.
You can line 'em up and knock 'em down.
Anything else I should know?
Don't hold out on me.
Your old buddies Darmas and Dodonna? They've been holed up with the Voidwolf for a few weeks now.
You need anything, you can talk to Curao--Rogun's fence on Corellia. I'll tell him you may be dropping in.
There's a better way! Follow me!
